intro: Fumaria incisa, commonly known as the common yellowweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in loose clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Fumaria incisa is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats.
